alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 8:40AM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow will gradually diminish this morning. Additional accumulations will range between 1 and 3 inches. Another round of snow will move into the mountains late tonight, and may become heavy at times Sunday afternoon with additional accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. Winds will also strengthen with gusts greater 60 mph above timberline producing considerable blowing and drifting snow over the higher mountain passes. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, and Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Road conditions will improve today, but will likely become slick and hazardous again Sunday morning. Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Consider traveling this afternoon and evening when conditions will be relatively good. If you must travel Sunday, be prepared for winter storm conditions. Have an emergency kit with you in case you are stranded.

area.areaDesc: South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
